action.action-desc: Mr. Lynch introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Transportation to enter into an agreement with the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine to produce a report that identifies and recommends a system of measuring aviation noise, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Peer-Reviewed Report on Measuring Metrics and Thresholds.

section.header: Report on system for measuring aviation noise

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Transportation shall seek to enter into an agreement with the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine in which the National Academies shall produce a report that identifies and recommends a system of measuring aviation noise that—

paragraph.text: with a highly reliable relationship, categorizes noise levels to determine compatibility for residential areas and high annoyance areas based on appropriate metrics; and
meets the requirements of section 47502(1) of title 49, United States Code.

subsection.text: In producing the report required under subsection (a), the National Academies shall—

subparagraph.text: multidisciplinary experts from public health and medical professions;
the Neighborhood Environmental Study conducted by the Federal Aviation Administration;
multiple metrics for measuring aviation noise, including—

clause.text: day-night average sound level between 40 and 75 dB;

subparagraph.text: the difference between local noise environments, including ambient noise, and aircraft-induced noise;
the effects of frequent and persistent noise events and the effects on next generation air transportation system technology; and

paragraph.text: address whether the metrics used to determine whether a change in noise levels in a next generation air transportation system has a significant or reportable impact on such system are appropriate metrics to be used in the system of measuring aviation noise described in subsection (a).
